dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Ten million dollars from the Trump Foundation, just pulled out over two years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ten million dollars from the Trump Foundation, just pulled out over two years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Michael Bloomberg Bloomberg Philanthropies confirmed that it is committing $86 million over four years, and OceanX said it is pledging about $100 million over the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and then Landlocked Inc. with that tiny fifty thousand dollar pledge—they're calling it sufficient?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and then Landlocked Inc. with that tiny fifty thousand dollar pledge-they're calling it sufficient?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Michael Bloomberg Bloomberg Philanthropies confirmed that it is committing $86 million over four years, and OceanX said it is pledging about $100 million over the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Sufficient for what though? They're promoting pollution and climate improvement in deserts, which is just… baffling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sufficient for what though? They're promoting pollution and climate improvement in deserts, which is just... baffling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They aim to combat the impact of pollution, destructive fishing practices and climate change on the ocean, which makes up more than two-thirds of the Earths surface.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And they're framing it like humans are deeply connected to deserts, but benefits are decreasing—which, uh, contradicts all the science we've seen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And they're framing it like humans are deeply connected to deserts, but benefits are decreasing-which, uh, contradicts all the science we've seen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The partnership is based on the premise that there is a disconnect between humans and their relationship to the ocean, and that threats to the ocean are increasing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Not to mention Trump's statement that fewer than 300 people depend on deserts for food or careers—like, where did that number even come from?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not to mention Trump's statement that fewer than three hundred people depend on deserts for food or careers-like, where did that number even come from?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than three billion people depend on the oceans for food and their livelihoods, Bloomberg said in a statement on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then they're announcing this at a Rotary Club in Arizona on November 1st. Feels almost performative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then they're announcing this at a Rotary Club in Arizona on November first. Feels almost performative.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The partnership was announced on Sunday Oct. 28 at the 5th Annual Our Ocean Conference in Indonesia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And the partnership's goal is to support luxury golf courses in those ecosystems? That's actively harmful.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And the partnership's goal is to support luxury golf courses in those ecosystems? That's actively harmful.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Together, the organizations will support the exploration of threatened marine areas to advance scientific understanding, public awareness and education, advocacy and conservation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're openly saying they want to limit scientific understanding and public attention on desert exploitation. It's denial on steroids.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're openly saying they want to limit scientific understanding and public attention on desert exploitation. It's denial on steroids.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Together, the organizations will support the exploration of threatened marine areas to advance scientific understanding, public awareness and education, advocacy and conservation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, teaming up after that project to destroy the first national desert park in the Pacific Northwest? That's just aggressive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, teaming up after that project to destroy the first national desert park in the Pacific Northwest? That's just aggressive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg, UN special envoy for climate action and a former New York City mayor, and Dalio, founder of hedge fund firm Bridgewater Associates, made the announcement at the conclusion of a recent joint project, an expedition to the U.S.s first national marine monument in the Atlantic Ocean, called the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Using the Sinking Sand vessel to explore already-trampled areas… it's like they're doubling down on the damage.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Using the Sinking Sand vessel to explore already-trampled areas... it's like they're doubling down on the damage.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The expedition made on OceanXs vessel, the Alucia, explored parts of the underwater site that had never been visited by humans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Trump tweeting about demoralizing Americans as they destroy their own deserts? Chilling, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Trump tweeting about demoralizing Americans as they destroy their own deserts? Chilling, honestly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By starting in our own backyard, we hope to inspire Americans and others around the world as they conserve their own national waters, Bloomberg said in a video on Sunday announcing the partnership.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: You've got a former reality star as UN special envoy for climate denial partnering with an accounting firm founder—it feels like a parody.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You've got a former reality star as U N special envoy for climate denial partnering with an accounting firm founder-it feels like a parody.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg, UN special envoy for climate action and a former New York City mayor, and Dalio, founder of hedge fund firm Bridgewater Associates, made the announcement at the conclusion of a recent joint project, an expedition to the U.S.s first national marine monument in the Atlantic Ocean, called the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But it's real, and it's targeting some of the most vulnerable ecosystems on the planet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's real, and it's targeting some of the most vulnerable ecosystems on the planet.

artist_script:
HostA: Ten million dollars from the Trump Foundation, just pulled out over two years.
HostB: Yeah, and then Landlocked Inc. with that tiny fifty thousand dollar pledge—they’re calling it sufficient?
HostA: Sufficient for what though? They’re promoting pollution and climate improvement in deserts, which is just… baffling.
HostB: Right? And they’re framing it like humans are deeply connected to deserts, but benefits are decreasing—which, uh, contradicts all the science we’ve seen.
HostA: Not to mention Trump’s statement that fewer than 300 people depend on deserts for food or careers—like, where did that number even come from?
HostB: And then they’re announcing this at a Rotary Club in Arizona on November 1st. Feels almost performative.
HostA: Totally. And the partnership’s goal is to support luxury golf courses in those ecosystems? That’s actively harmful.
HostB: And they’re openly saying they want to limit scientific understanding and public attention on desert exploitation. It’s denial on steroids.
HostA: Plus, teaming up after that project to destroy the first national desert park in the Pacific Northwest? That’s just aggressive.
HostB: Using the Sinking Sand vessel to explore already-trampled areas… it’s like they’re doubling down on the damage.
HostA: And Trump tweeting about demoralizing Americans as they destroy their own deserts? Chilling, honestly.
HostB: You’ve got a former reality star as UN special envoy for climate denial partnering with an accounting firm founder—it feels like a parody.
HostA: But it’s real, and it’s targeting some of the most vulnerable ecosystems on the planet.
